subject: Assertions in JUnit
msgSnippet: Assertions say whether the test was success or not.Is there any other way in JUnit where we can find out if the test case has gone succesfully or not?
messageBody:
Assertions say whether the test was success or not.Is
there any other way in JUnit where we can find out if
the test case has gone succesfully or not?
(Automated....i dont want to go to the logs and read
it)

Also, if i want to generate reports using JUnit and
ANT, I need to have assertions in my test class. Is
that right?





--- Shaun Smith <shauns@...> wrote:
> Another example (although not boolean) is from Sun's
> JAI. The real
> offenders are now mercifully deprecated but some of
> these caused me quite
> a lot of headscratching:
>
> create(String opName, RenderedImage src, float
> param1, int param2, float
> param3, float param4, Object param5)
>
> create(String opName, RenderedImage src, Object
> param1, Object param2,
> Object param3, Object param4, Object param5, Object
> param6)
>
>
http://java.sun.com/products/java-media/jai/forDevelopers/jai-apidocs/javax/
> media/jai/JAI.html
>
> >
> > In other words, a method like doIt(myObject,
> anotherObject, true,
> > false, true, true);
> >
>
>
